skill.name: pymoo
skill.description: Multi-objective optimization framework. NSGA-II, NSGA-III, MOEA/D, Pareto fronts, constraint handling, benchmarks (ZDT, DTLZ), for engineering design and optimization problems.
skill.summary: Multi-objective optimization framework. NSGA-II, NSGA-III, MOEA/D, Pareto fronts, constraint handlin...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate documentation and example-based skill for the pymoo optimization library. All code performs pure mathematical computations using numpy and matplotlib without any network calls, credential access, or file system manipulation beyond its own directory.

content.value_statement: You need reliable solutions for single or multi-objective optimization problems. This skill provides ready workflows, examples, and guidance for pymoo.
actual_capabilities: Run single-objective optimization with GA on built-in problems
Solve multi-objective problems with NSGA-II and visualize Pareto fronts
Handle many-objective problems with NSGA-III and reference directions
Define custom ElementwiseProblem classes with constraints
Apply MCDM selection using PseudoWeights after optimization
Use scatter and parallel coordinate plots to compare results
limitations: Requires pymoo and Python dependencies to be installed
Examples focus on Python workflows, not other languages
Video visualization needs ffmpeg for export
Decision making examples assume normalized objectives

use_cases.title: Benchmark algorithm study
use_cases.description: Compare NSGA-II and NSGA-III on ZDT and DTLZ problems and analyze Pareto fronts.

use_cases.title: Design trade-off search
use_cases.description: Optimize weight, cost, and performance with constrained custom problems.

use_cases.title: Objective balance selection
use_cases.description: Select preferred solutions using MCDM after multi-objective runs.

prompt_templates.title: Single objective start
prompt_templates.prompt: Solve a single-objective problem using GA on rastrigin with 10 variables and 200 generations.

prompt_templates.title: Bi-objective run
prompt_templates.prompt: Run NSGA-II on ZDT1 and summarize the Pareto front quality and size.

prompt_templates.title: Many-objective setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure NSGA-III for DTLZ2 with five objectives using suitable reference directions.

prompt_templates.title: Custom constrained model
prompt_templates.scenario: Define and solve a domain problem
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to define a constrained ElementwiseProblem and solve it with NSGA-II.

output_examples.input: Run NSGA-II on ZDT1 and summarize results.
output: Algorithm: NSGA-II with population 100 for 200 generations
Front shape: convex and close to the true front
Next step: visualize with a scatter plot to inspect spread

best_practices: Set a random seed for reproducibility
Choose termination criteria based on problem scale
anti_patterns: Mixing constraints without converting to g <= 0 form
Comparing objectives without scaling when ranges differ

faq.question: Is this compatible with pymoo 0.6.x?
faq.answer: Yes, the examples and workflows are based on pymoo 0.6.x.

faq.question: What limits the runtime?
faq.answer: Population size, generations, and objective evaluation cost dominate runtime.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into my Python pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, the examples are standard Python code and can be embedded in scripts.

faq.question: Does it access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No, it only provides local example code and documentation.

faq.question: What if I get few feasible solutions?
faq.answer: Review constraint formulations and consider penalty or constraint-as-objective methods.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic optimizers?
faq.answer: It focuses on multi-objective and Pareto-based methods with specialized tools.
